name: baby calf
description:
In addition to my career as a letterpress printer, I run the "NICU" on my brother's ranch. This was one of my charges back in 2007 - baby Clover. I bottle-fed her for many weeks and she was pretty sure I was her mama, following me around everywhere until we had a cow who could adopt her. This print is from a photograph I took of her, in the evening, after feeding her a bottle. I love the details on this print - the texture of the grass and even her long long little eyelashes. Cute as a button! 

Printed in magenta ink on soft, thick, 100% cotton paper and paired with 100% PCW recycled brown kraft envelopes.

set of 5
3.5" by 5" 
folded cards w/ envelopes

name: aspen
description: Hand-drawn aspen trees, in all their Autumnal splendor. Set of 5. Extra special three-color letterpress flat cards printed on soft 100% cotton white paper. (One color of golden yellow wasn't enough, so I added another layer slightly darker to give them more dimension.) 5" square with matching white square-flap envelopes. My web address is blind-pressed discretely on the back side of each card.

name: redwoods
description: Taking perspective from photographs of the mighty redwoods, I originally drew this pair of trees for a wedding invite. The result was so striking that I couldn't resist printing a few blank cards of the same design. Letterpress printed in brown ink on super-nice 100% cotton paper. The adorably petite flat cards are a perfect fit for the matching 5" square 'brown bag' 100% recycled (PCW) envelopes. My web address is blind-pressed discretely on the back side of each card. You can go here to see more pics, if you like. set of 5 5" x 5" square flat cards w/ envelopes

name: blackbirds
description: Each Fall, blackbirds gather by the hundreds into great swarms, swooping and swirling, then settling on the fences, telephone lines, and trees. I took a photograph of one such swarm of blackbirds, in the tree outside my kitchen window, in the Fall of 2007. I transfered the photograph to a plate and then letterpress printed each card by hand. I chose an autumnal tan color for the paper and paired it with blue envelopes, to invoke the brilliant blue skies of Fall-time. They turned out really lovely. You can go here to see more pics, if you like. set of 5 4.25" x 5.5" folded cards w/ envelopes

name: tools
description: I have a set of encyclopedias from 1889 with amazing etchings (out of copyright). These tool images are some of my favorites, with all the funny awesome names for the different types of tools. There are 6 different designs [wrenches, tongs, blocks(pulleys), saws, squares, trowels] and each set has one of each design. You can go here to see pics of the other cards, if you like. I hand letterpress printed each card on Rives BFK 100% cotton paper, in a rich tan color. Each card has a strip of papyrus 'wood' paper glued to the inner edge and is folded just short of the middle so that a bit of it shows from the front. {The process of gluing this finicky material onto each card by hand is ridiculously time-consuming, but really makes these extra-special.} set of 6 cards 3.5" x 5" folded cards w/ envelopes
